body: @ricardomm85, @bizley would you please take a look?
That should be #17944 when the model was replaced with dynamic model.
I think I have a solution. Let me test it a bit before PR.

issue.title: Adding support for custom rule in EachValidator

labels.name: status:ready for merge
labels.description: The pull request is OK to be merged.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️
| New feature?  | ❌
| Breaks BC?    | ❌
| Tests pass?   | should
| Fixed issues  | #18051 

This changes a bit how the InlineValidator is created in case of model-method-based inline validators. Instead of just passing a method's name now there is an array with an instance of Model in question and the method's name. This works thanks to the fact that `call_user_func` can take such array as first parameter so there should be no BC change.

Since EachValidator creates a new instance of DynamicModel internally this change allows inline validators defined in the original model to be used.

I haven't checked all possible drawbacks here. Definitely now method that is inline validator cannot have limited visibility but I haven't checked if it could be the case before this change.

Please take a look and see if this can be the solution to the issue. If so, I will add changelog.

issue.title: Need add info to UPGRADE.md from 2.0.34

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Yii2 version 2.0.35.
Model with validator:

[
  'ids',
  'each',
  'rule' => [
    'in',
    'range' => function (self $model) {
      return $model->allowIds;
    }
  ]
],

### What is the expected result?

No errors

### What do you get instead?

TypeError
Argument 1 passed to MyForm::{closure}() must be an instance of MyForm, instance of yii\base\DynamicModel given

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.34
| PHP version      |  7.2
| Operating system | Windows 10

Problem in Yii 2.0.35 after commit https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/355ca1562ddf6b25b5db3d1b62e138aa503087a9#diff-331f73fc0a09f0f46df28de5e87f7a6a

I think need add info to UPGRADE.md from 2.0.34 about EachValidator: in anonymous function first argument instead current model use DynamicModel.

body: Looks like it works, let me know what you think.
@1Luc1 please check if it is OK with master version.

issue.title: EachValidator & InlineValidator don't work together

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
<!--
Please use this issue tracker for bugs and feature requests only. In case you need support please use one of
Yii communities listed at https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/wiki/communities
-->
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/17810 introduced a new way of using EachValidator: it uses a new instance of DynamicModel to run the validations on. This breaks the InlineValidators that'd use $this->$attribute in an inline anonymous function.

### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Have a model with an array attribute.
Create a rule in your model with EachValidator, and as a rule set an inline function, causing an InlineValidator instance to be created. In this inline anonymous function, try checking if the members of the array are valid by accessing $this->$attribute.

### What is the expected result?
$this should be the actual object on which the function was called, $this->$attribute should be one member of the array in each call.

### What do you get instead?
$this is bound to the original Model class, and $this->$attribute is the array attribute.

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.35
| PHP version      | 7.4
| Operating system | Windows

issue.title: Error loading Settings screen

repository.name: craft-breakpoint
repository.description: A Craft 3 plugin for testing responsive layouts in Live Preview.

issue.body:
## Description

The Settings screen is inaccessible, with error:

Calling unknown method: yii\base\DynamicModel::validatePreset()

It looks as if this is due to a regression in EachValidator with custom validation, described initially here:
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/18051

I guess there's not much that can be done until Craft updates Yii to v2.0.36 ?

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install the plugin
2. Visit /admin/settings/plugins/breakpoint

## Expected behavior

Settings screen operable.

## Additional context

- Plugin version: 2.0.0
- Craft version: 3.4.30
- Browser and version: Chrome 84.0.4147.105 (OSX)
